intro: Geum camporum, commonly known as meadow avens, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its basal leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small, aggregate fruits that disperse its seeds, contributing to its natural distribution. Geum camporum is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
